fields_of_interest: Education and training, Research and innovation, Public Health, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives: Cost of Brain Disorders, Funding and research on brain and neuroscience, Support of the European Directive 2010/63/EU on the protection of animals used for scientific purposes
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
FENS is a federation of national neuroscience societies across Europe (33 national societies) and 10 monodisciplinary societies: 
http://www.fens.org/about/members/national.html 
http://www.fens.org/about/members/mono.html
goals__remit:
FENS works for the public benefit to advance research and to develop neuroscience education in Europe. 
 
For this purpose the society aims to  
1. promote interaction and coordination between its member societies and to develop neuroscience research across nations and disciplines 
2. facilitate the interaction between neuroscientists and related scientists 
in Europe and outside Europe  
3. facilitate the dissemination of scientific information  
4. support education and training of young neuroscience researchers  
5. promote understanding and involvement in neuroscience among the general public and advise decision-makers on the importance of neuroscience research
relevant_communication:
Open Letter on recent developments in science in the US:  
A large number of major European organisations in the area of science, research, innovation and higher education, including FENS, have written an Open Letter to European Prime Ministers, as well as the President of the European Council and of the European Commission, and Commissioner Carlos Moedas for Research and Innovation to express their concern about recent developments in the US. 
Brain Awareness Week: FENS, on behalf of the Dana Foundation, offers financial support of up to 1,000 EUR to event organisers within Europe during the Brain Awareness Week.
